Q&A with filmmaker Errol Morris on his 1988 The Thin Blue Line documentary, generative AI, disinformation, reenactment, his new Separated documentary, and more  —  “Our task is to get back to the real world, to the extent that it is recoverable.”  —  Errol Morris is used to being called a liar, a trickster, and a manipulator.

item.title: ソーシャルメディア・プラットフォームの憲法修正第1条の権利に関する米連邦準備制度理事会（SCOTUS）のNetChoice判決が、子どものオンライン安全法を含む多くのテック関連法案にどのような影響を与えるか（Lauren Feiner/The Verge

How the SCOTUS NetChoice ruling on social media platforms' First Amendment rights could affect a host of tech legislation, including kids' online safety laws  —  Here's what the SCOTUS decision might mean for everything from kids online safety laws to the TikTok ‘ban.’

item.title: インディーズ映画制作者向けのバーチャル制作サービスを開発する韓国のBeeble AIが、評価額2500万ドルで475万ドルのシード資金を調達した（Kate Park/TechCrunch）
item.description:

South Korea-based Beeble AI, which is developing virtual production services for indie filmmakers, raised $4.75M in seed funding at a valuation of $25M  —  Visual effects (VFX) have emerged as essential in filmmaking and have transformed storytelling and creativity in the film industry with its diverse digital techniques.

item.title: 米著作権局、楽曲の権利を取り戻したソングライターが実際にストリーミング使用料を受け取れるようにすることを目的とした新ルールを最終決定（Bill Donahue/Billboard）

The US Copyright Office finalizes a new rule aimed at ensuring that songwriters who reclaim rights to their music will actually get paid streaming royalties  —  The new rule clears up uncertainty about who gets paid streaming royalties when songwriters take back their music rights - a trickier question than it sounds.
